channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Baby boomers have now ‘gobbled up’ nearly one-third of America’s wealth share, and they’re leaving Gen Z and millennials behind
item.description: American septuagenarians hold more than $85 trillion in assets—by far the most of any generation.

item.title: Paramount, Netflix spur Wall Street race to win jumbo loan deals
item.description: Loans of this size have been few and far between over the past couple of years amid subdued acquisition activity. But that’s all changed.

item.title: Jared Kushner suddenly emerges in the Warner brawl between Paramount and Netflix, backed by Saudi billions and fresh off brokering another megadeal
item.description: Trump’s son-in-law is emerging as a central conduit for Gulf money moving into American media, and they’re backing the Ellisons and Paramount.

item.title: Parents are sacrificing retirement, taking second jobs, and liquidating investments just to afford college for their kids
item.description: More than 60% of parents say they’re delaying retirement to pay for college.

item.title: Trump Stands in the Middle as Netflix and Paramount Vie for a Megadeal
item.description: The president has shattered norms by pledging to “be involved” in the regulatory fate of a transaction that could reshape the news and entertainment i...

item.title: Jasmine Crockett Enters U.S. Senate Race in Texas, Reshaping Democratic Primary
item.description: The announcement by the congresswoman, a rising star in the party, came hours after another prominent candidate, Colin Allred, dropped out.

item.title: FBI Agents Sue Patel After Being Fired Over Kneeling at George Floyd Protest
item.description: A five-year-old photo of agents kneeling at a D.C. protest after George Floyd’s killing led to the firing of about 16 agents.

item.title: Supreme Court Seems Poised to Give Trump More Power to Fire Independent Officials
item.description: A ruling in the president’s favor in the case, which deals with his attempt to remove a member of the Federal Trade Commission, would be a major expan...

item.title: ‘This isn’t what Walt and Roy would have wanted’: Disney fans with disabilities sue over new ride restrictions
item.description: Disney narrowed the scope to guests who “due to a developmental disability such as autism or similar” have difficulties waiting in a long line.

item.title: Golden Globe 2026 Nominees: Full List Including ‘One Battle After Another’
item.description: The movies and TV series competing for the 83rd Golden Globes. The ceremony will air on Jan. 11.

item.title: Dogs in Kimonos: Japan Reinvents a Children’s Holiday With Pets in Mind
item.description: A traditional Japanese festival is being adapted for poodles and Pomeranians, amid a booming pet industry and a dearth of children.

item.title: Trump Criticizes Zelensky as Ukraine Peace Talks Drag On With European Leaders
item.description: Despite pressure from the Trump administration, Mr. Zelensky, after meeting with European leaders who vowed continued support in the war, said Ukraine...

item.title: Maps: 7.6-Magnitude Earthquake Near Japan Prompts Tsunami Alert
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter, aftershocks and shake area.

item.title: The Second ‘China Shock’
item.description: Chinese exports are flooding the developing world, and the social consequences are bound to be profound.

item.title: Pups in Kimonos Receive Blessings During Japanese Holiday
item.description: Pet owners dressed their dogs in kimonos and custom belts to receive blessings at a Shinto shrine last month. This was part of a children’s festival, ...
